definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: Liberal pundits foam at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨專家氣得口吐白沫。

sentences.english: The liberals prefer to sit on the fence while the other parties fight it out.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨寧可抱騎牆態度，坐待其他黨派去鬥爭到底。

sentences.english: Mr Tien pledged his party's support for Mr Tung for a second term.
sentences.chinese: 田北俊聲明自由黨支持董建華連任。

sentences.english: There is a great divide between liberals and conservatives in the government.
sentences.chinese: 政府涇渭分明地分爲了自由黨和保守黨兩個黨派。

sentences.english: In one poll last week, she ranked behind both Callaghan and the Liberals' David Steel as a campaign performer.
sentences.chinese: 在選舉前一週，她的表現不如卡拉漢和自由黨的大衛。

sentences.english: More and more people are inclining toward the Liberal Party.
sentences.chinese: 愈來愈多的人傾向於自由黨了。

sentences.english: The liberal candidate romped through with thousands of votes to spare.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨候選人輕易獲勝，超出選票數以千計。

sentences.english: Liberal Party Chairman James Tien described the party's results in the District Council election last Sunday as "not too bad".
sentences.chinese: 自由黨主席田北俊形容該黨今屆區選成績不過不失。

sentences.english: More broadly, the fight was over the Liberal Party's future direction.
sentences.chinese: 說白了，這場鬥爭是自由黨未來的發展方向之爭。

sentences.english: A liberal is a man too broadminded to take his own side in a quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨人就是思想太開明而在論戰中沒立場的人。

sentences.english: Conservatives generally criticize liberals for wanting obtrusive big government.
sentences.chinese: 保守黨一般批評自由黨想要咄咄逼人的大政府。

sentences.english: He has joined the side of the Liberals.
Liberal Party leader James Tien Pei-chun also said the single-developer approach was not the only option.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨主席田北俊亦表示單一招標並非唯一的選擇。

definition: the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
member of the US House of Representatives
